intro: Jacquemontia platycephala, commonly known as the broad-headed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to purple flowers. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often twining around supports. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. Jacquemontia platycephala is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
